home.helpCenterDesc:
Here you can find all the information you need to know about the EML AdminTool.
If you have any suggestion of tutorial or question, you can tell it in this Discord channel.
home.filesUpdater: Manage the files that the Launcher needs download
home.bootstrap: Manage the bootstrap of your Launcher
home.maintenance: Manage the maintenance of your Launcher

database.content:
A Database is necessary for the operation of the EML AdminTool.
The exact way to create a database depends on your hosting company, although the steps are basically the same.

Login

Log in to the management space of your website (Plesk, cPanel, ...).
Look for the "Database" section.

Create a Database

You should arrive on a page offering you to create a Database and then choose a username, password and name for the Database.
Be sure to choose a strong enough password: the Database contains information that can compromise the security of your website and Launcher. Do not use special characters, spaces, dashes, ... for the username and the name of the Database. Use only lower case letters and numbers (and underscores _).
Your database is now created!

When configuring the EML AdminTool

When configuring the EML AdminTool, you will be asked for a database.
You will certainly be able to find the information of your database on your website management panel.
Be careful! It is useless to put :3306 after the database host!

pin.content:
On this page, you will understand what the 3-digit Security Code is for, as well as how to find and obtain it.

What is the 3-Digit Security Code?

The 3-digit security code is a security feature to prevent spamming of account creation requests on EML AdminTool. When someone wants to create a Standard account (as opposed to an Administrator account that has all the permissions and chooses the Standard account permissions), the Administrator account receives an account acceptance request and grants certain permissions or not to the account in question.
If anyone could create an account, the Administrator would be overwhelmed with requests.The 3-digit Security Code should therefore only be given to Minecraft server staff members of this EML AdminTool.

How to find and use the 3-digit Security Code? - For the Administrator

The 3-digit Security Code was randomly generated for you when you configured the EML AdminTool. You can find it on the EML AdminTool Administrator panel.

You should only give this code to trusted people who will need to use the EML AdminTool. This code will be requested during account creation. Once this is done, you can assign permissions to this new user.

If the code is leaked and you receive too many regular account creation requests, you can regenerate it on the EML AdminTool management page.

How to get the 3-digit security code? - For Standard users

You have to ask the EML AdminTool Administrator for it. He can refuse to give it to you if he thinks that you do not need to access the EML AdminTool.
However, it is essential to know it to be able to register on the EML AdminTool. Be careful ! You are not notified when the 3-digit security code you entered is incorrect!
Once you have registered, the Administrator can choose to refuse you or to accept you. In the latter case, he/she may assign certain permissions to you.

filesUpdater.content:
In this tutorial, you will be able to understand in a few lines how the Launcher downloads Game files.

Simple use

Just upload files from the Files Updater option and the Launcher will download it.
In addition, the Launcher compares the hashes of each file already downloaded with the hash of the file uploaded to the EML AdminTool. If the hashes are different, the file will be re-downloaded. This optimizes the loading time of the Launcher

The set of files that the Launcher must download is called the ModPack. This should be composed as follows: config/
mods/
resourcepacks/
minecraft.jar
servers.dat
 In the config folder are the mods configurations files.
In the mods folder are the mods that the Launcher should download.
In the resourcepacks folder are the texture packs that the Launcher should download for the player.
The minecraft.jar file corresponds to Forge or MCP in the correct version. If your Launcher launches Minecraft in Vanilla version, you can leave it out. If your Launcher runs Minecraft with Forge, you need to download the Forge installer for the desired Forge version from this website. Upload this same file to the EML AdminTool! There is no need to run this file before placing it in the ModPack!
The servers.dat file is optional. It contains the list of multiplayer servers that will need to be entered in the Multiplayer menu of Minecraft. For more information, please refer to this page.

If the file(s) you want to upload is/are heavy, expect a loading time.

Complex use

The Files Updater option is limited in functionality.
If you want to transfer a large amount of files/folders, move items to other directories, ..., it is advisable to use an FTP client such as WinSCP or FileZilla and connect with the credentials found on the panel site management (Plesk, cPanel, ...).
The files are located in the /api/files-updater/files/ directory.

bootstrap.content:
This tutorial explains what the Launcher bootstrap is and explains how to use it correctly.

What is a bootstrap?

A bootstrap is software that is automatically launched when the Launcher is started in order to check that the latter is up to date. If not, it automatically downloads the new update. This saves Launcher users from having to visit your site to update their Launcher.

Use the bootstrap

To apply a Launcher update, you must go through the Bootstrap option. You will then upload a file for each OS: Windows, macOS and Linux (Debian and Ubuntu). If your Launcher is not compatible with one of these systems, upload a "random" file ending with the correct extension (.exe, .app or .deb). Indeed, all fields must be completed.
You will also need to indicate the new version. This new version must be superior to the version currently online. For example, if the current version is 1.0.3, the new version could be 1.0.4, 1.1.2 or 2.2.0 (for example).

If your files are not uploading, they may be too large. By default, the limit indicated on the EML AdminTool is 500 MB, but PHP can also apply a limit. To modify this limit, it is necessary to modify the values post_max_size to 1500M and upload_max_size to file 500M of the file php.ini (if your host allows it). Otherwise... you're stuck ðŸ˜…...

maintenance.content:
This tutorial explains what Launcher maintenance is, what it is for.

What is maintenance?

Enabling Launcher maintenance will block access to the Launcher for players.
It is recommended to activate it only in case of real necessity, for example, when a major security vulnerability is discovered. You can also notify Launcher users of the reason for this maintenance, and schedule an approximate end date.
Please note that this end date does not automatically deactivate maintenance, but just informs players of a possible end of maintenance on that date; maintenance must be disabled manually.

It should also be understood that activating maintenance is not a foolproof way to block access to the Launcher (due to the Launcher license obliging to disclose the source code of the Launcher and therefore to modify it).

Update a Launcher in maintenance

Once maintenance is enabled, you may want to update your Launcher.

In order to be able to access the Launcher despite the maintenance activated, you must modify a value in the file package.json.
Locate the following line: "bypassMaintenance": false Change the value to true like so: "bypassMaintenance": true Maintenance will no longer affect your Launcher during update testing.
Before exporting your Launcher and offering an update, remember to set this value back to false.

news.content:
In this tutorial, you will be explained how to add, edit or delete News from the EML AdminTool, using HTML formatting.

Simple use

Using News on the EML AdminTool is simple.
To add a News, you must put a short title, and a content.
Optionally, you can also add an image in the Image Link field. This image can be hosted on an image host, such as Zupimages. If you don't want an image, leave the field blank.

HTML formatting

In the News content, you can add formatting. This formatting is in HTML format: <b>Bold</b>
<i>Italic</i>
<u>Underline</u>
<a href="https://yourlink.com/">Link</a> Result: Bold
Italic
Underline
Link Be careful! For the link, do not forget to specify the http:// or https:// in the href="", without which the link will not be valid, and therefore unusable by the Launcher user.

If you think that this message is not normal, please contact your Administrator
